question:
Your son is learning a second language at school, but he needs some extra lessons. 
Write a letter to a teacher asking for her help. In your letter 

Explain why your son needs help
Ask the teacher about her teaching experience and methods
And suggest a possible schedule for the lessons.
text: I am writing this letter to request your support for my son, whom you are teaching Spanish. His name is Sparsh and studying in seventh grade.

We are leaving for Spain by the end of this year because of my husband's job. That is why we opted for Spanish for our son so that he can easily get admission to the school in Spain. Now, I am thinking that if you can give him some extra classes so that he can learn fast that would be great.

In addition to this, I would definitely like to know how much experience you have in this profession and how you are teaching students in the class. I would be happy to help you as I have been a teacher for twenty years so I understand how hard it is to understand children's behaviour.

I would like to know if you are available over the weekend for one or two hours, I would be happy to send my child for extra classes. I am sure he can learn fast if you try teaching him using the computer as he is fond of it.
I really appreciate the positive revert from you.
